abstract: With BP shares plunging since the oil rig accident, many are speculating about the company’s options, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.
snippet: With BP shares plunging since the oil rig accident, many are speculating about the company’s options, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.
lead_paragraph: It seems unthinkable, even now, that the disastrous oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico could bring down the mighty BP. But investment bankers get paid to think the unthinkable — and that is just what they are doing, The New York Times’s Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.

headline.main: Imagining the Worst in BP’s Future
